page.title: 18Slindon College Animals.
page.content: In the College grounds,Mr.P.J.Wright, the Headmaster, owns and keeps a great variety of animals. These include goats,wallabies,sheep,chickens, peacocks, ornamental birds, and race horses. The boys enjoy helping in this area of school life,feeding the animals, milking the goats and cleaning the cages,pens and aviarys. Some of the boys have rabbits and other pets such as snakes,ferrets and guinea pigs, and these are looked after by their owners and the animal boys. There are also peafowl, but these seem to take care of themselves, and roost in the surrounding trees at night. In the grounds there are also man_made ponds which are full of natural wildlife, and these have proved useful as well as beautiful,as the Biology Department uses them for some lessons.
